intro: Drymonia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican drymonia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweeds. The plant is characterized by its upright, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically ovate to lanceolate in shape and have a rough, textured surface. Drymonia mexicana is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
